awd_abstract_narration: Auburn University requests support from NSF for connection of its               campus network to SURAnet.  SURAnet is the midlevel network located             in the southeastern United States where Auburn University is                    located. SURAnet will provide operations management and information             services and it will give Auburn a high speed connection (1.5                   milliion bits per second) to the NSFNET, a high speed (1.5 - 45                 million bits per second) National Backbone network.                                                                                                             Auburn University needs greater functionality and network speed to              be able to access supercomputers, libraries, and make file                      transfers along with being able to implement a more reliable mail               system. Students and faculty research will benefit from the link.               This is also a unique opportunity for the school to explore                     innovative educational resources.***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
